conbody.p:
You can navigate to the query options in two ways.
From Excel: tab Data Get Data (group Get & Transform Data) Query Options
From Query Editor: File options and settings
Query Options
Only the most relevant settings will be covered. And several settings are self-explanatory.

section.title: GLOBAL Data Load
section.p: Using one of the aforementioned methods you get the following window.

image.alt: Window query options global data load

section.p:
It is important to distinguish between Global and Current Workbook settings:
GLOBAL: settings will affect all the projects you create.
CURRENT WORKBOOK: settings will affect only the current Excel file .

The data load settings affect how the queries are loaded. The standard load settings are
When loading a single query the query is loaded to a new worksheet.
When loading multiple queries the queries are loaded to the Data Model.

A preferred method is to load a query manual. In that case you select Specify custom default load settings and unticking both choices. Then only a connection is build and you need to load the query manually:

ul.li: In Excel: tab Data Queries & Connection Right click on query Load to
In Query Editor: tab Home Close & Load Load to

section.p: By enabling the Fast Data Load option, your queries will take less time to load, but Excel may be unresponsive for long periods.
Copies of queries preview results are stored on your local disk for faster viewing later. You can clear this cache or configure how much disk space is allowed to be used.
section.note: Cleaning the cache can be useful when something is not working as expected.

section.title: Global Power Query Editor

image.alt: Window query options global power query editor

section.p: These options mostly have to do with how the Query Editor appears. The formula bar converts your actions into Power Query M language. Itâ€™s possible to edit the code in the formula bar. If you prefer, you can select to display preview content in monospace font and not to show whitespace and newline characters.
section.note: Some of these options can also be found on tab View in de Query Editor.

section.title: Global Privacy
section.p: When you are combining data from various sources then it is possible that you get lots of error messages because these actions can conflict with your privacy level settings. These messages mostly make no sense to the end user. To avoid these messages you can savely select Always ignore Privacy Level settings.

section.title: Current Regional Settings
section.p: The regional settings affect how Power Query manipulates dates, currencies and other features specific to regions & countries.
